page.title: 07Museum Art Gallery
page.content: BODELWYDDAN CASTLE continuedthis report appeared in the Liverpool Daily Post on 18th Sept., 1985. "Work has started on what will be the home for the National Portrait Gallery at Bodelwyddan Castle. The Castle was bought by Clwyd County Council for transformation with a museum, arts, and education complex. It will become the gallery's third out station in the region with more than 100 portraits of famous Victorian figures. Council Chairman, Cllr. Edgar Jones, said, "The gallery's decision to locate in Clwyd was a tremendous addition to the County's cultural facilities and would give an added dimension to the local tourist industry. It will provide an immensely prestigious core for the cultural centre, being developed at the Castle."
